item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Annie Dillard
item.description: "Like any child, I slid into myself perfectly fitted, as a diver meets her reflection in a pool. Her fingertips enter the fingertips on the water, her wrists slide up her arms. The diver wraps herself in her reflection wholly, sealing it at the toes, and wears it as she climbs rising from the pool, and ever after." -- Annie Dillard

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Julia Child
item.description: "I was 32 when I started cooking; up until then, I just ate." -- Julia Child

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Juan Pablo Villalobos
item.description: "Hair is like a corpse you wear on your head while you're alive." -- Juan Pablo Villalobos

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Naomi Wolf
item.description: "A culture fixated on female thinness is not an obsession about female beauty, but an obsession about female obedience. Dieting is the most potent political sedative in womenâ€™s history; a quietly mad population is a tractable one." -- Naomi Wolf
